channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Biden and Xi take a first step to limit AI and nuclear decisions at their last meeting
item.description: The leaders agreed that humans should control decisions to use nuclear weapons — not AI. And they talked about the importance of stability during the transition to a new U.S. administration.
item.content:encoded:
The leaders agreed that humans should control decisions to use nuclear weapons — not AI. And they talked about the importance of stability during the transition to a new U.S. administration.

(Image credit: Leah Millis)
item.dc:creator: Asma Khalid

item.title: Trump announces oil executive Chris Wright as his pick for energy secretary
item.description: Trump announced Chris Wright, the CEO of oil and natural gas fracking services company Liberty Energy, as his pick for energy secretary.
item.content:encoded:
Trump announced Chris Wright, the CEO of oil and natural gas fracking services company Liberty Energy, as his pick for energy secretary.

(Image credit: Alastair Pike)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: A derogatory term for Native women will be removed from place names across California
item.description: The word "squaw" was declared derogatory by the Department of Interior in 2021. Since then, hundreds of geographic features have been renamed with input from local tribes and Indigenous communities.
item.content:encoded:
The word "squaw" was declared derogatory by the Department of Interior in 2021. Since then, hundreds of geographic features have been renamed with input from local tribes and Indigenous communities.

(Image credit: Max Whittaker)
item.dc:creator: Mansee Khurana

item.title: Sixth beach house collapses in North Carolina's Outer Banks in the past 6 months
item.description: The daily effects of strong winds, large waves, as well as rising sea levels — which are fueled by human-caused climate change — are causing beaches on the Outer Banks to wash away.
item.content:encoded: The daily effects of strong winds, large waves, as well as rising sea levels — which are fueled by human-caused climate change — are causing beaches on the Outer Banks to wash away.
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: In France, a family reckons with World War II Allies' legacy of rape and murder
item.description: In 1944, as Allied troops celebrated D-Day victory, a French family experienced a trauma that would be felt for generations: a murder and sexual assault so traumatic they are only now coming to terms with it.
item.content:encoded:
In 1944, as Allied troops celebrated D-Day victory, a French family experienced a trauma that would be felt for generations: a murder and sexual assault so traumatic they are only now coming to terms with it.

(Image credit: Eleanor Beardsley)
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Beardsley

item.title: Fire engulfs a hospital ward in northern India, killing 10 newborn babies
item.description: A fire tore through a neonatal intensive care unit in a hospital in northern India, killing 10 newborn babies and injuring 16 others, authorities said.
item.content:encoded:
A fire tore through a neonatal intensive care unit in a hospital in northern India, killing 10 newborn babies and injuring 16 others, authorities said.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Jake Paul beats 58-year-old Mike Tyson in a much-hyped Netflix boxing match
item.description: Jake Paul won a unanimous decision over Mike Tyson as the hits didn't match the hype in a fight between a young YouTuber-turned-boxer and the 58-year-old former heavyweight champion.
item.content:encoded:
Jake Paul won a unanimous decision over Mike Tyson as the hits didn't match the hype in a fight between a young YouTuber-turned-boxer and the 58-year-old former heavyweight champion.

(Image credit: Julio Cortez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: This county is the most religiously diverse in the U.S.
item.description: This stretch of New Hampshire Avenue in Silver Spring, Maryland is so packed with houses of worship, it's been called the Embassy Row of Religions. But locals know it as the Highway to Heaven.
item.content:encoded:
This stretch of New Hampshire Avenue in Silver Spring, Maryland is so packed with houses of worship, it's been called the Embassy Row of Religions. But locals know it as the Highway to Heaven.

(Image credit: Sarah Ventre)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Opinion: Uranus was having a bad hair day. Hey, it was the '80s!
item.description: Scientists are reconsidering old information about Uranus. NPR's Scott Simon explains the problem with photos taken of the planet 38 years ago.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists are reconsidering old information about Uranus. NPR's Scott Simon explains the problem with photos taken of the planet 38 years ago.

(Image credit: AFP)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: The NWSL rides a 'rocket ship' of interest in women's sports to a record-setting year
item.description: Across the board, 2024 was a record year for women's sports. The WNBA saw record audiences. In college basketball, the women's March Madness tournament outdrew the men's. The NWSL was no exception.
item.content:encoded:
Across the board, 2024 was a record year for women's sports. The WNBA saw record audiences. In college basketball, the women's March Madness tournament outdrew the men's. The NWSL was no exception.

(Image credit: Timothy Nwachukwu)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan
